website_summaries.verdict: This beautiful Italian-made roasting pan with colored ceramic enamel makes any dinner a special occasion.
pros: Consists of heavy-gauge aluminum as well as aesthetically pleasing ceramic
cons: Can only withstand oven heat up to 350°F

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy This Pan
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pan a little over a year ago. I cured it as directed and have used it with great care. It began scratching using non scratch utensils and it also started sticking, despite repeated curing. The "Lifetime Warranty" is meaningless as it does not cover "normal use" only "defects". Is a pan advertised as non-stick and non-scratch that does scratch and stick not defective? Only buy this if you want to pay $35 for a pan that only lasts about a year. I would never buy another Tramontina product.
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: If You Love to Cook This is The Best Cooking Pan for You or as a Gift to Someone Who Does
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, I have been trying to find a good fry pan that cooks and cleans without to much trouble. This pan is incredible. Follow the directions for preparing pan with small amount of cooking oil and your eggs will slide off the pan like cars on ice. Cleaning the pan is the next best thing to cooking, wipe with paper towel. A small amount of cooking oil or (butter) and you can saute with ease. Careful to not slide your food onto the stove when you are cooking. I am Arthur Ramirez and I approve this message. No Campaign money was used. .
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: The pot worked well in the beginning but the inside coating started to chip and scratch under normal use when I only use plastic/silicon utensils. I would not recommend buying this product to anyone. My Caphalon pots and pans I had previously lasted 8 years and I mainly replaces them for a change in color/style. I'll be going back to Caphalon and stick with them
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: truly non-sitck
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using it a couple of weeks so can't attest to durability. But otherwise this is a great pan. Comfortable to hold, even heating, sides have the right slope, and the least sticky non-stick pan I've ever owned. In fact, food slides so easily it's sometimes difficult to get a spatula under it, it just pushes away. UPDATE: It's been 10 months and the pan, after nearly daily use, is no longer non-stick. I suppose that's a decent life for non-stick pans, but I can't see adding to the landfill every several months, so I'm going to try a carbon steel pan.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this pan!
customer_reviews.text: I have a large stainless set from Tramontina that I have used and loved for more than 10 years. I really wanted to try ceramic and this was on sale so I bought it. It's perfect. Great on the cooktop and in the oven. I got the copper color and it's so pretty. Nothing sticks to this thing and cleaning is beyond easy. I usually just rinse and wipe. I am going to buy more of these for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Sharis

customer_reviews.title: Great pan. Non-stick is great! Cleans perfectly easy.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this pain for quite a few months now and I love it. It’s non-stick qualities are as good as any Teflon pan. Cleaning it is a breeze. And I’m not worried about any weird chemicals from those other non-stick pans. I don’t know how long the non-stick lasts because I’ve heard it wears off after a while but I haven’t experienced that yet.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction, to thin for the size.
customer_reviews.text: Made with way to thin of a bottom and started to warp the first time cooking. This causes a small part of the bottom to touch the stove top and overheat, and this makes the problem even worse. Within a couple of weeks became completely useless as it has now created a wobbling and uneven heated bottom. We have a smaller pan by the same brand that works great, but the larger one is not thick enough bottom for the size of the pan. We are always careful with not shock cooling pans, or overheating them, this one is just not thick enough for the size.
customer_reviews.author: C. Utagawa

customer_reviews.title: An amazing buy! I used it many times and it ...
customer_reviews.text: An amazing buy! I used it many times and it still looks like new. Clean up is a breeze and I don't have to use aluminum foil to roast my veggies anymore. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy, NYC

customer_reviews.title: Quality check yourself before you wreck yourself
customer_reviews.text: This is the most disgusting thing that has ever been shipped to my home. A dirty, used pan, coated in grease. I couldn't possibly review it because there is zero chance I am insane enough to cook with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really non-stick and great cooking!
customer_reviews.text: After seeing some bad reviews I was on the fence about buying this brand. I bought the 8" first and LOVED it, so I bought the 10" too and LOVE it as well. So easy to fry with, washes clean so easily. Substantial thickness. I have the 6.5 Qt pot from Tramontina too. It's very heavy, even without food in it , but I enjoy cooking sauces and soups in it. I'd buy another item if I needed it. My T-Fal pots and pans pale in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Eggs began sticking after 30 days of use
customer_reviews.text: I seasoned it before use as directed in the insert. I use low heat-level 3 out of 12- on electric burner and coat the pan with a thin coat of melted butter. Scrambled eggs began sticking after a month of use. I re-seasoned the pan but to no effect. Any ideas appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Teflon replacement
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a pan that does not have the chemicals in the non-stick coating of the pan(Teflon,etc). After much research and some good reviews, we found this pan that was ceramic coated and decided to try it. We've had it a couple of months and so far it works as good or better than our old Teflon pans. It is easy to clean and heats evenly preventing burning. The one minor concern is that you have to be careful not to scratch the ceramic surface like Teflon but this is not that big of an issue.
customer_reviews.author: For the Truth

customer_reviews.title: Great set!
customer_reviews.text: We have an entire set of Tramontina and love that it doesn't have PFOE, etc. I feel safe using it. The surface does, however, scratch easily so be careful. The tip of our dish scrubber dinged up a pot after just a few washes. I use the small saucepan daily to warm milk for my coffee so that has gotten the most use and it did wear after about a year. I don't mind replacing something that I use daily but other people may be bothered by longevity issues (which is, I think, a standard issue with ceramic in the first place).
customer_reviews.author: StaceyA

customer_reviews.title: Ceramic surface does wear quickly
customer_reviews.text: I got five years of light use and just had to throw my pan out. The cooking surface got weird grooves in it from the dishwasher. I purchased a similar pan from another brand and it has lasted better than this brand. The pan showed wear pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: ZumbaLover

customer_reviews.title: It was great at the beginning though
customer_reviews.text: I used this a couple of times a week to make eggs and pancakes and after a couple of months the non stick properties lessened to the point that i just threw the pan away. It was great at the beginning though. I wouldn't buy this again
customer_reviews.author: SN

customer_reviews.title: This has to be a fake Tramontina & not a ceramic coating
customer_reviews.text: The ceramic surface - even after seasoning twice at high heat with ghee - is not even close to non-stick - an egg cooked with evoo even sticks.. The coating has worn off in spots in less than a year - all pans are stored in between foam pads and hand washed. Bought a larger Tramontina from a local homegoods store and have had no issues. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: P4D4

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as other Tramontina pans.
customer_reviews.text: This is not as good as our last one. Tramontina Normally makes a good pen. This one seems to not be as sticky and to hold on to stains quicker. As far as heating it seems to work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Dave F.

customer_reviews.title: Nice pan but...
customer_reviews.text: I like this pan. It was bigger than I thought it would be but very light. My only concern it is that the ceramic surface scratches very easily. Mine had small scratches after the second use. Bummer. I don't know if the scratch parts will rust as it is still fairly new. Not too happy about this and I am not sure how it got scratched as I used a plastic spatula. If the surface continues to scratch I do not think I will be buying similar items as they are pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa D

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I followed the seasoning instructions before use. Twice to be extra sure. It does great at no stick, but the cream color is impossible to keep clean. I would not recommend or buy again as the pan always looks dirty.
customer_reviews.author: dar

customer_reviews.title: Takes forever to boil
customer_reviews.text: I bough this pot to boil noodles. It takes forever to boil, even at the forbidden high temp. It's a beautiful pot, but I don't know how long I can take waiting 20-30 min for the water to start boiling!
customer_reviews.author: Jeni Saulino

customer_reviews.title: Chipping after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: We have had it for six months now and don't use any metal utensils on the pot. However, it is starting to chip. This is disappointing. We had high hopes for this pot and the Tramontina brand. We bought their cast iron which is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: MKT

customer_reviews.title: I was expecting a larger pan !
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first 20 uses and then -- just like all the others -- things started to stick and hard to clean ! We bought a 3 pan set at Walmart for 1/2 the price of this and are much happier !
customer_reviews.author: woodchuck

customer_reviews.title: My first pan that doesn't stick!!! Updated: For a year. Then everything started sticking to it.
customer_reviews.text: Loved it! But now I have to look into warranty, cause even though I was following the instructions on how to keep it nonstick and all, it still started to "glue" food to itself. From an excited customer to disappointed in a year. :(
customer_reviews.author: Oli

customer_reviews.title: Scratched within a week
customer_reviews.text: I only use wood or "plastic" utensils. The pan had several scratches on the "ceramic" surface with only a few uses. You might as well buy the junk from China, they scratch at the same rate but at half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Carfino

customer_reviews.title: At first food sticks to it just like any other frying pan,but it gets better the more you use it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made stylish 8 " copper red metallic frying pan made of aluminum with a creamy white ceramic lining, and a non slip black rubber handle with a chrome tip made in Italy. It weighs 1 lb. The ceramic lining needs to be heated and cured with cooking oil 3 or four times to stop it from stiking. It cleans up easily and keeps it's good looks. It does require a little oil or butter to prevent sticking when cooking
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D. Levier

customer_reviews.title: Not really PTFE free
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product because it said that it was free of both PTOA and PTFE. Yet the box and enclose printed materials say nothing about being PTFE free, only PTOA free. If the product is really free of PTFE, the box and materials need to say so.
customer_reviews.author: cn79

customer_reviews.title: Pot arrived bent!!
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to receiving this Dutch oven... but it arrived BENT and now the lid won't fit! I think I bought the last one, too. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: Did not last :(
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for this guy, so I took care of this like a newborn babe. Kidding... but I only washed it by hand, never cooked above medium heat, and even seasoned it with oil after it began to stick. I've owned it for now 2 months and about half of it is no longer non-stick (it's rather stick).
customer_reviews.author: Hannah g.

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile investment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my worn out non-stick and wasn’t disappointed. So far it seems to be better than traditional non-stick skillets. I’m hoping the ceramic holds up, but so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: CynicalMisanthrope

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Pan
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best pan I've ever owned. The build quality is superb, and it doesn't feel cheap at all. The ceramic non-stick surface has been fantastic to cook on. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: absolutely in love with this
customer_reviews.text: So far, absolutely in love with this! Making scrambeled eggs on low, noburns, easy to make and they just slide out. Fried eggs I just put a touch, and Imean touch of butter in and the eggs are like a slip and slide. You can do it with none if desired! Definitely buying the set soon.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this pot for 5 months and the inner coating has already started chipping. I mostly use it to cook pasta and rice; nothing too sticky. So it was a disappointment to see how fast the quality deteriorated. Won't recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Ardalan

customer_reviews.title: Not what we expected from this company
customer_reviews.text: We have used Tramontina products before and have been very pleased. Unfortunately, this item looks good but is very light and easily burns the food. Looks can be deceiving; waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: BASU PARTHAPRATIM

customer_reviews.title: This one looked good, and not too expensive
customer_reviews.text: We needed a new skillet for our electric stove. This one looked good, and not too expensive. It is great! Very even heating, and very easy to clean. It looks like the non-stick surface is working fine, but time will tell. We have had it about 2 months. This is a replacement for a very expensive stainless-steel "professional" pan, and we are not disappointed at all.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pan for the price but degrades relatively quickly. After 6 months food like scrambled eggs stick to the bottom, something that didn’t occur when I first started using it. Slowly growing disappointed with the purchase. I plan to spend more to buy a different product in the hope that the nonstick lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: wr81

customer_reviews.title: This is a good looking pan
customer_reviews.text: This is a good looking pan, the first new one I've bought in years. Reviews on ceramic pans are all so varied that I wanted to try one out before buying a set. I seasoned this pan in the recommended way and even use a little coconut or avocado oil each time I use it. The eggs still stick and leave a residue that I need to soak out. Not as challenging as my stainless pans, but not non-stick as I had hoped....oh well. It's a nice size and great looking, as well as the perfect weight.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: I love this sauce pan except
customer_reviews.text: This sauce pan looks pretty. It's very easy to clean, not heavy and heat-conductive. I would have given it a five-star if not for the piece of metal on the handle. When I tried to lift the lid, the metal piece on the handle was so very hot that I had to use a towel to lift it up. On the whole, I love this suace pan except for the piece of metal. I would suggest the manufacturer to take that piece of metal off the handle. If not for the piece of metal on the handle, I would buy some more sauce pans of different sizes.
customer_reviews.author: jessie

customer_reviews.title: looses its non-stick coating after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: This would be a nice product if it didn't loose its non-stick coating. Worked terrific for 4 months then scramble eggs started sticking, then bacon. For the price, you're better off shopping at Marshalls and picking up a similar pan for $10
customer_reviews.author: p2pca

customer_reviews.title: Good quality non-stick pan
customer_reviews.text: I have other Tramontina stuff and it is all really great quality - this pan is no exception. I'm really impressed with how evenly it heats and how quick the clean up is. I am planning to buy another one in a different size. Economical, good quality, does its job - what more could you want.
customer_reviews.author: zoe

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful pan!
customer_reviews.text: Love this pan! Very well made. It is my new go-to pan. The non-stick surface works wonderfully and I have not had any issues. Be sure to read the directions on how to season this pan to keep it lasting a long time. Will definitely buy more from this manufacturer. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon C.

customer_reviews.title: Love My Tramontina!
customer_reviews.text: Another great Tramontina product. I swear by the quality Tramontina and this item is no different. I appreciate the ceramic non-stick surface. As other reviewers have noted, the metal in the middle of the lid's handle requires a hot pad to avoid a burned/scorched hand.
customer_reviews.author: Broz

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this pot! Use it to cook rice, brown whole spices, sautee veggies and the occasional dessert. Cleans up easily and looks good!
customer_reviews.author: JitenG

customer_reviews.title: As expected, very nice ceramic finish.
customer_reviews.text: Our other similar ones are several years old, and I can tell a big difference in the slipperiness, but that is to be expected, as they do wear down with time and occasional abuse.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of kitchen gear although the diameter is smaller than I prefer.
customer_reviews.text: I failed to mention this pan in my other review for Ozeri; this one is also great. I would say Ozeri, Traimontina tied with GP, and then "W," would come in last place out of the four I bought. Excelsior!
customer_reviews.author: Staff S.

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of this pan and how easy it is to clean. I only use a plastic spoon on it but already it is beginning to look like it is scratched.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: and best of all
customer_reviews.text: The Tramontina line is totally smooth, tough, and best of all . . . beautiful. I will continue to add pieces to my collection over the next year.
customer_reviews.author: NetGod

customer_reviews.title: Scratched after only a few uses
customer_reviews.text: At first we liked this pan. It is definitely non-stick. The porcelain coating started to scrape off after about 5 washes, and we have been very careful to use non-abrasive cleaners.
customer_reviews.author: txgrl99

customer_reviews.title: Buy the best!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several brands of ceramic because of safety. Tramontina is by far the best! This year I purchased them for Christmas gifts. I know my family will have a hard time making themselves pay the high price for the best, but its not high compared to the cheaper ones that we threw away in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Nate the Grate

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I love this set. Nothing sticks to these pots and pans!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Millan

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: I have the same brand pan in a smaller size. Love it which is why I ordered larger one
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: First of all, they are beautiful pots...
customer_reviews.text: What more can I say; this pot and it's little brother, the 1.5 qt. were put to use immediately after washing. First of all, they are beautiful pots, but more importantly, they seem to have the cooking features and abilities that attracted our attention. So much so that we ordered another 1.5 qt. pot again a few days later!
customer_reviews.author: Bigiron99

customer_reviews.title: The only one I've found that lasts!
customer_reviews.text: Love this pan. It works, as advertised without any sprays or oils.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph F. Wootten

customer_reviews.title: Now it's getting worse. It's only ever been handwashed and I've only ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for 8 months and the ceramic started chipping/pitting about 2 months ago? Now it's getting worse. It's only ever been handwashed and I've only ever used wood utensils with it. Best pan I've used before it started chipping though.
customer_reviews.author: RSreview

customer_reviews.title: First of all, they are beautiful pots...
customer_reviews.text: What more can I say; this pot and it's big brother, the 3 qt. were put to use immediately after washing. First of all, they are beautiful pots, but more importantly, they seem to have the cooking features and abilities that attracted our attention. So much so that we ordered another 1.5 qt. pot again a few days later!
customer_reviews.author: Bigiron99

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hesitate to buy!
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best pan I’ve ever owned! Cleans easily and very even heat distribution. I had to get used to things cooking quicker than with my Calphalon pans.
customer_reviews.author: TraciC

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: This pan works well with very little oil or butter.
customer_reviews.author: lynn

customer_reviews.title: Also it tells you you can't use sprays like PAM but stuff still sticks a little and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for a couple weeks and it is already scratched. I do not use metal. Also it tells you you can't use sprays like PAM but stuff still sticks a little and the spray helps to crisp hash brown potatoes, etc so all you can use it for is saute. You are almost better off with old fashioned Teflon.
customer_reviews.author: david a witter

customer_reviews.title: I love this sauce pan
customer_reviews.text: I love this sauce pan!! I have not been using it for very long but so far it's great. I intend to take good care of it and hopefully at some point I will buy a set. It is a nice color (red) and the l.5 qt. size is very versatile. I think this was a good choice for my kitchen!!
customer_reviews.author: sbrown

customer_reviews.title: ... had this for a month but so far it's great. I followed directions and seasoned it first and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for a month but so far it's great. I followed directions and seasoned it first and it's worked perfectly. I use it multiple times a day and it still looks like brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Hendershott

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: After only 4 weeks of light use, the coating on the bottom has dings in it! We own other ceramic pots and none have had this problem in such a short time... AND we only use wood spoons. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: H. A. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Best Pan Ever! Easy Cleanup!
customer_reviews.text: Best pan I have every used. Easy cleanup, very thick and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Camera

customer_reviews.title: Huge value for the money
customer_reviews.text: If there’s a better pan set than this one it certainly cooks by itself and cleans itself. This one is perfect! I feel I actually got a thousand more value than I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Calixto Said

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could get my money back
customer_reviews.text: Worst pan ever everything sticks no matter what you do
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN BENNETT

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with scratches
customer_reviews.text: Got it out of the box - had scratches on the corner
customer_reviews.author: Margarita

customer_reviews.title: Scratched easily, metal tabs on handles get hot
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a 5 qt pot that could go in the dishwasher and have heard well about Tramontina, and also liked the color, so I purchased this pot. Two weeks later the interior ceramic is scratched (I don't recall using any pointy metal utensils in it). It also befuddles me why they would cover the handles with the silicone but leave a metal tab exposed, the metal tab does get hotter than the silicone, defeating the purpose of the silicone altogether. Style over functionality I guess. I then purchased the cheaper "Martha Stewart Collection Porcelain Enameled Strainer Stockpot, 6 Qt." and am delighted with it.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Tramontina is good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the quality of the Tramontina pans I have purchased. Foods clean easily from the ceramic surface.
customer_reviews.author: Leochic

customer_reviews.title: Cooks like a dream and cleans up so easily
customer_reviews.text: My second Tramontina product. This pan is outstanding. Cooks like a dream and cleans up so easily. Non-stick surface is truly non stick. A fried egg will do the tango in this pan......don't even need oil. I recommend this pan highly. You will enjoy using it.
customer_reviews.author: Herbster

customer_reviews.title: Good frypan
customer_reviews.text: Got it yesterday, seasoned the pan, cooked bacon and eggs. Non stick surface worked great.
customer_reviews.author: J's VW

customer_reviews.title: Just ok, very lightweight, coating seems good
customer_reviews.text: I guess it's ok for the price but I would have preferred to spend more and get something heavier and thicker.v the aluminum seems thin. I wonder how heat will conduct. I am just used to heavier pans such as stainless.
customer_reviews.author: 1GoodDog

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Like the way it’s made because the cheap ones the bottom always warped and this has a good heavy bottom and it is so easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Guddy Gawura

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Handle is easy to hold. So far, not sticking.
customer_reviews.author: UmMa

customer_reviews.title: ... a 10 inch pan to see if my husband liked it and he did
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 10 inch pan to see if my husband liked it and he did. He then wanted a larger pan and it is so easy to clean. It cooks great on medium heat and so far my husband has not destroyed it and this is from a former high heat cook.
customer_reviews.author: SD RN

customer_reviews.title: love this pot!
customer_reviews.text: I look constantly for ceramic lined cookware at fair prices and this fit the bill. The other ceramic lined cookware has lasted for years with no nonstick lined worries Very easy to clean. One design suggestion - take the small metal pieces off of the handles so you can lift the lid without policyholders.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Lenz

customer_reviews.title: Best Cook Wear EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I started with this sauce pan and I am slowly purchasing more of the Tramontina line. Before purchasing, I shopped very carefully as I do quite a bit of cooking and wanted something that was non stick without any toxic issues surrounding the cook wear surface. Before the first use, you will need to season the surface which is extremely easy to do, rendering it virtually stick-free. This pan has it all; excellent conductivity, completely nonstick without the health problems associated with past non stick pans, very light weight and extremely easy to clean. If you too are a Foodie that loves to cook. you will not be disappointed with this line.
customer_reviews.author: Green Raven

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is ceramic and not T-Fall. Also that it is not made in China.
customer_reviews.author: mrsams

customer_reviews.title: New favorite
customer_reviews.text: After many years of faithful service, I tossed out my old family skillet. I really wanted something better than the non-stick stuff, so I went with this one. I love it so much, I'm going to be collecting the set, little by little.
customer_reviews.author: C. KC

customer_reviews.title: I bought this fry pan for the sole purpose of ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fry pan for the sole purpose of frying eggs. I have only used it a few times and so far it has performed as expected with no sticking. I simply wiped it out with a paper towel. It is very well made. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: T Turner

customer_reviews.title: small dent on rim (photo 1) and crack and dent bottom of pot (photo 2)
customer_reviews.text: Since this product didn't have reviews, i looked for reviews of the individual items in the package and they were highly rated. I received them today and i was instantly excited to see the quality was to par. Such a lovely set, but the packaging (don't know if amazon or the supplier) wasn't as it should be. Two of my items (5 qt pot and cookie sheet) have visible dents from the journey.
customer_reviews.author: Daniella

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time and money
customer_reviews.text: A piece of junk. Don't waste your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm very satisfied with the skillet. I love cooking on a low fire and this skillet browns without cooking on a high fire. Great!
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Strothers

customer_reviews.title: Not copper colored
customer_reviews.text: The set seemed great but when the arrived I was so dissapointed to see they are not copper like the name/description indicates, they are like a dark brown/red.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. S.

customer_reviews.title: A good option for the price, but the white will stain after a few months' use
customer_reviews.text: Decent for the price - it cooks evenly and predictably, but it is nowhere near nonstick if you cook with little or no oil, and the white ceramic will begin to stain after a few month.
customer_reviews.author: hwilberg

customer_reviews.title: ... gift and I don't know about them but I love the one I have
customer_reviews.text: I gave it as a gift and I don't know about them but I love the one I have. It grills nicely and cleans up so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Dolores

customer_reviews.title: WHY
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of eating teflon. This Tramontina ware is excellent. Am looking for more of same. Super construction. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Payson G Kirchhoff Jr

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean, no nonstick coating that scratches or flakes off. High quality cookware.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Really like this pot!
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like this pot. How well it will wear remains to be seen. If I have any problems in the months to follow I will do an update.
customer_reviews.author: Little Star

customer_reviews.title: I love this pan!
customer_reviews.text: I love this ceramic fry pan. It is so easy to use, no stick and very easy cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalinda

customer_reviews.title: Great Pan.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic pan. Like it so much we purchased the remainder of the set. And so easy to clean it puts the Teflon coated ones to shame.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Corson

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Don't understand why they put metal patches on those handles which can be so hot during cooking!
customer_reviews.author: NN

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: What can I say , my wife loves this pan. Definitely non stick and very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Carl B.

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs-Up
customer_reviews.text: Pleasure to cook in. Looking forward to years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Mitali C.

customer_reviews.title: hard to clean.
customer_reviews.text: food baked on and even stained the pan. i cannot get it clean. cooking after that the food sticks to it.
customer_reviews.author: smile, Jesus loves you.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: SCRATCH EASILY. ALL I USED FOR WAS TO COOK RICE SOUP FOR MY BABY!
customer_reviews.author: bunnylovebun

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Scratches easy. Hard to use for pizza, can't use pizza cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Linda McCreight

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: What an outstanding small skillet. I followed the SIMPLE seasoning instruction and made myself an omelet. It was truly NON-STICK; which also means easy to clean, like cast-iron.
customer_reviews.author: jwm1941.dec

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to my pots and pans.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase this after seeing the reviews but took a leap of faith. I am so pleased with this produuct. I would happily buy this as a present for someone also. The color is nice also. The handles could be a bit larger but it doesn't take away from the performance of this pot.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Everything is awesome except the metal parts on the handles
customer_reviews.text: Everything is awesome except the metal parts on the handles. They get hot which makes the handles not very effective.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Edwards

customer_reviews.title: not too bad..
customer_reviews.text: for flipping eggs over, it needs a bit more slope in the sides, other than that, not too bad...
customer_reviews.author: djmonson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this is light weight. I've used it a few times now and have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Ksu834

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: We really love this tray. Easy to wash, fits in the dishwasher well.
customer_reviews.author: Karin

product_meta.title: Tramontina 80110/054DS Style Ceramica 01 Roasting Pan, 14 by 10-Inch, Metallic Copper
product_meta.description: Style Name:Roasting Pan| Size:10-Inch| Color:Metallic CopperTramontina's Ceramica_01 Copper features heavy-gauge aluminum construction for lasting use and even heat distribution plus a ceramic cooking surface for effortless food release and easy cleanup. The Ceramica_01 Copper is part of Tramontina Style, a collection of products of outstanding quality, design, functionality and value, featuring the latest innovations and color trends in kitchenware items. The Tramontina Style products provide the optimum in functionality and exceptional durability.
feature_bullets: Cold-Forged, heavy-gauge aluminum construction for even heat distribution
Durable, easy-to-clean metallic copper porcelain enamel exterior
Compatible with gas, electric and ceramic glass cook tops
Dishwasher-safe; Oven-safe up to up to 350°F/ 176°C
Made in Italy, assembled and packaged in the USA; Lifetime Warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars487 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
